meanings.definition: To carry in the womb during pregnancy.
meanings.sent1: The mother was gestating a baby in her belly.
meanings.sent2: She is currently gestating her first child.
meanings.sent3: The idea was gestating in her mind for months before she finally acted on it.
meanings.sent4: His plan was gestating quietly, waiting for the perfect moment to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The seed was gestating in the soil, preparing to sprout into a beautiful flower.

meanings.definition: To conceive and gradually develop in the mind.
meanings.sent1: The writer was gestating a new story idea in his mind.
meanings.sent2: Ideas gestating in the mind can lead to great innovations.
meanings.sent3: The solution to the problem was gestating in his mind, waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: Creativity was gestating within her, ready to burst forth in a wave of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The concept was gestating in his thoughts, slowly taking shape before becoming a reality.
